Package org.apache.calcite.avatica.remote

Class AvaticaServersForTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.calcite.avatica.remote.AvaticaServersForTest
  • public class AvaticaServersForTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class which encapsulates the setup required to write Avatica tests that run against servers using each serialization approach.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  AvaticaServersForTest.FullyRemoteJdbcMetaFactory
      Factory that provides a JdbcMeta.
      static class  AvaticaServersForTest.PropertyRemoteJdbcMetaFactory
      Factory that provides a JdbcMeta with properties.

      • getJUnitParameters

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> getJUnitParameters()
        Computes an array of parameters to support JUnit's parameterized tests. The Object array actually contains a Driver.Serialization and the HttpServer instance in that order.
        Returns:
        A list of arrays of Serialization and HttpServer pairs.

      • getJdbcUrl

        public java.lang.String getJdbcUrl​(int port,
                                   org.apache.calcite.avatica.remote.Driver.Serialization serialization)
        Computes the JDBC url for the Avatica server running on localhost, bound to the given port, and using the given serialization.
        Parameters:
        port - The port the Avatica server is listening on.
        serialization - The serialization the Avatica server is using.
        Returns:
        A JDBC URL to the local Avatica server.

      • getJdbcUrl

        public java.lang.String getJdbcUrl​(int port,
                                   org.apache.calcite.avatica.remote.Driver.Serialization serialization,
                                   java.lang.String urlSuffix)
        Computes the JDBC url for the Avatica server running on localhost, bound to the given port, using the given serialization, with the user-provided suffix for the HTTP URL to the server.
        Parameters:
        port - The port the Avatica server is listening on.
        serialization - The serialization the Avatica server is using.
        urlSuffix - Extra information to apend to the HTTP URL to the Avatica server (optional).
        Returns:
        A JDBC URL to the local Avatica server.
